lead_paragraph: Troubled by low returns and high expense ratios, investors are fleeing the struggling asset class. But portfolio managers say the worries could be overblown.

headline.print_headline: An Exit From Emerging Markets May Be Hasty
headline.main: Emerging Markets, Even in Turmoil, Have a Place in a Portfolio

snippet: Troubled by low returns and high expense ratios, investors are fleeing the struggling asset class. But portfolio managers say the worries could be overblown....
abstract: Portfolio managers of emerging market mutual funds say investors are overreacting to volatility of sector, noting booms and busts are appropriate for riskier asset class; say despite chronic underperformance, economies of emerging countries are in reasonably good shape, with higher growth rates and lower debt levels; recommend investors diversify rather than dump holdings.
